trans-unit.source:
After a successful COPY invocation, all dead properties on the source resource SHOULD be duplicated on the destination resource. Live properties described in this document SHOULD be duplicated as identically behaving live properties at the destination resource, but not necessarily with the same values. Servers SHOULD NOT convert live properties into dead properties on the destination resource, because clients may then draw incorrect conclusions about the state or functionality of a resource. Note that some live properties are defined such that the absence of the property has a specific meaning (e.g., a flag with one meaning if present, and the opposite if absent), and in these cases, a successful COPY might result in the property being reported as "Not Found" in subsequent requests.
When the destination is an unmapped URL, a COPY operation creates a new resource much like a PUT operation does. Live properties that are related to resource creation (such as DAV:creationdate) should have their values set accordingly.
trans-unit.target: 在成功的 COPY 调用之后,源资源上的所有死属性都应该被复制到目的资源上。本文档中描述的活属性应该在目标资源中被复制为表现相同的活属性,但不一定具有相同的值。服务器不应将目标资源上的活属性转换为死属性,因为客户机可能会对资源的状态或功能得出错误的结论。请注意,有些活属性的定义使得该属性的缺失具有特定的含义(例如,一个标志,如果存在,则具有一种含义,如果不存在,则具有相反的含义),在这些情况下,成功的复制可能会导致该属性在后续请求中被报告为 "未找到"。当目标是一个未映射的 URL 时,COPY 操作会像 PUT 操作一样创建一个新资源。与资源创建相关的实时属性(如DAV:createdate)应该有相应的值设置。

trans-unit.source:
All DAV headers follow the same basic formatting rules as HTTP headers. This includes rules like line continuation and how to combine (or separate) multiple instances of the same header using commas.
WebDAV adds two new conditional headers to the set defined in HTTP: the If and Overwrite headers.

trans-unit.source: All HTTP/1.1 messages consist of a start-line followed by a sequence of octets in a format similar to the Internet Message Format [RFC5322]: zero or more header fields (collectively referred to as the "headers" or the "header section"), an empty line indicating the end of the header section, and an optional message body. HTTP-message = start-line *( header-field CRLF ) CRLF [ message-body ] The normal procedure for parsing an HTTP message is to read the start-line into a structure, read each header field into a hash table by field name until the empty line, and then use the parsed data to determine if a message body is expected. If a message body has been indicated, then it is read as a stream until an amount of octets equal to the message body length is read or the connection is closed. A recipient MUST parse an HTTP message as a sequence of octets in an encoding that is a superset of US-ASCII [USASCII]. Parsing an HTTP message as a stream of Unicode characters, without regard for the specific encoding, creates security vulnerabilities due to the varying ways that string processing libraries handle invalid multibyte character sequences that contain the octet LF (%x0A). String-based parsers can only be safely used within protocol elements after the element has been extracted from the message, such as within a header field-value after message parsing has delineated the individual fields. An HTTP message can be parsed as a stream for incremental processing or forwarding downstream. However, recipients cannot rely on incremental delivery of partial messages, since some implementations will buffer or delay message forwarding for the sake of network efficiency, security checks, or payload transformations. A sender MUST NOT send whitespace between the start-line and the first header field. A recipient that receives whitespace between the start-line and the first header field MUST either reject the message as invalid or consume each whitespace-preceded line without further processing of it (i.e., ignore the entire line, along with any subsequent lines preceded by whitespace, until a properly formed header field is received or the header section is terminated). The presence of such whitespace in a request might be an attempt to trick a server into ignoring that field or processing the line after it as a new request, either of which might result in a security vulnerability if other implementations within the request chain interpret the same message differently. Likewise, the presence of such whitespace in a response might be ignored by some clients or cause others to cease parsing.
trans-unit.target: 所有HTTP / 1.1消息均包含一个起始行，后跟一系列八位字节，其格式类似于Internet消息格式[ RFC5322]：零个或多个标头字段（统称为“标头”或“标头部分”），指示标头部分结尾的空行以及可选的消息正文。 HTTP消息=起始行*（标头字段CRLF）CRLF [消息正文]解析HTTP消息的正常过程是将起始行读入结构，按字段名将每个标头字段读入哈希表直到空行，然后使用解析的数据来确定是否需要消息正文。如果已指示消息主体，则将其作为流读取，直到读取等于消息主体长度的八位字节数量或关闭连接为止。接收者必须将HTTP消息解析为八位字节序列，并采用US-ASCII [美国ASCII]。由于字符串处理库处理包含八位位组LF（％x0A）的无效多字节字符序列的方式各不相同，因此将HTTP消息解析为Unicode字符流而不考虑特定的编码会产生安全漏洞。基于字符串的解析器只能在从消息中提取了元素之后才能在协议元素中安全使​​用，例如，在消息解析描述了各个字段之后，在标头字段值中使用。可以将HTTP消息解析为流，以进行增量处理或向下游转发。但是，由于某些实现会出于网络效率，安全性检查或有效负载转换的目的而缓冲或延迟消息转发，因此收件人不能依赖于部分消息的增量传递。发送方不得在起始行和第一个标头字段之间发送空格。在起始行和第一个标头字段之间接收到空格的接收者必须拒绝该消息为无效消息，或者在不对其进行进一步处理的情况下使用每条以空格开头的行（即，忽略整行，以及后面带有空格的任何后续行） ，直到收到格式正确的标头字段或标头部分终止）。请求中存在这样的空白可能是试图诱使服务器忽略该字段或将其作为新请求处理后的行，如果请求链中的其他实现将相同的内容解释为同一请求，则这两种方法都可能导致安全漏洞。消息有所不同。同样某些客户端可能会忽略响应中此类空白的存在，或导致其他客户端停止解析。

trans-unit.source: All conditional headers try to check if the resource stored on the server matches a specific version. To achieve this, the conditional requests need to indicate the version of the resource. As comparing the whole resource byte to byte is impracticable, and not always what is wanted, the request transmits a value describing the version. Such values are called validators, and are of two kinds:
trans-unit.target: 所有条件标头都尝试检查服务器上存储的资源是否与特定版本匹配。为此，条件请求需要指示资源的版本。由于将整个资源字节与字节进行比较是不切实际的，而且并非总是如此，因此请求将发送一个描述版本的值。这些值称为验证器，有两种：

trans-unit.source: All documents in the images/ folder will be redirected to a different domain.
trans-unit.target: images/ 文件夹中的所有文档将被重定向到其他域。

trans-unit.source: All hosts which aren't fully qualified, or the ones that are in local domain, will be connected to directly. Everything else will go through w3proxy:8080. If the proxy goes down, connections become direct automatically:
trans-unit.target: 所有资质不全的主机,或者是本地域名的主机,都会直接连接到。其他的都会通过w3proxy:8080。如果代理宕机,连接会自动变成直连。

trans-unit.source: All iframes inherit the policy of their parent page. If the iframe has an allow attribute, the policies of the parent page and the allow attribute are combined, using the most restrictive subset. For an iframe to have a feature enabled, the origin must be in the allowlist for both the parent page and the allow attribute.
trans-unit.target: 所有iframe都继承其父页面的策略。如果iframe具有 allow 属性，则使用限制性最强的子集来组合父页面的策略和 allow 属性。要使iframe启用功能，原点必须在父页面和allow属性的允许列表中。

trans-unit.source: All local accesses are desired to be direct. All proxy servers run on the port 8080 (they don't need to). Note how strings can be concatenated with the + operator in JavaScript.
trans-unit.target: 希望所有本地访问都是直接的。所有代理服务器都在端口8080上运行（它们不需要）。请注意如何在JavaScript中使用+运算符将字符串连接在一起。

trans-unit.source:
All methods that might be expected to cause modifications to the origin server's resources MUST be written through to the origin server. This currently includes all methods except for GET and HEAD. A cache MUST NOT reply to such a request from a client before having transmitted the request to the inbound server, and having received a corresponding response from the inbound server. This does not prevent a proxy cache from sending a 100 (Continue) response before the inbound server has sent its final reply.
The alternative (known as "write-back" or "copy-back" caching) is not allowed in HTTP/1.1, due to the difficulty of providing consistent updates and the problems arising from server, cache, or network failure prior to write-back.
trans-unit.target: 所有可能会导致修改源服务器资源的方法都必须写入源服务器。这目前包括除了GET和HEAD之外的所有方法。在向入站服务器发送请求,并从入站服务器收到相应的响应之前,缓存必须不回复客户端的请求。这并不妨碍代理缓存在入站服务器发送最后的回复之前发送100(Continue)的回复。在HTTP/1.1中不允许采用另一种方式(称为 "回写 "或 "回抄 "缓存),因为在回写之前,很难提供一致的更新,而且会出现服务器、缓存或网络故障的问题。

trans-unit.source: All modern browsers and servers do support it and the only thing to negotiate is the compression algorithm to use. These algorithm are optimized for text. In the 1990s, compression technology was advancing at a rapid pace and numerous successive algorithms have been added to the set of possible choices. Nowadays, only two are relevant: gzip, the most common one, and br the new challenger.
trans-unit.target: 所有现代的浏览器和服务器都支持它，唯一需要协商的就是要使用的压缩算法。这些算法针对文本进行了优化。在1990年代，压缩技术飞速发展，许多连续的算法已添加到可能的选择中。如今，只有两个相关： gzip （最常见的一个）和 br 新挑战者。

trans-unit.source: All of the mechanisms specified in this document are described in both prose and an augmented Backus-Naur Form (BNF) similar to that used by RFC 822 [9]. Implementors will need to be familiar with the notation in order to understand this specification. The augmented BNF includes the following constructs: name = definition The name of a rule is simply the name itself (without any enclosing "<" and ">") and is separated from its definition by the equal "=" character. White space is only significant in that indentation of continuation lines is used to indicate a rule definition that spans more than one line. Certain basic rules are in uppercase, such as SP, LWS, HT, CRLF, DIGIT, ALPHA, etc. Angle brackets are used within definitions whenever their presence will facilitate discerning the use of rule names. "literal" Quotation marks surround literal text. Unless stated otherwise, the text is case-insensitive. rule1 | rule2 Elements separated by a bar ("|") are alternatives, e.g., "yes | no" will accept yes or no. (rule1 rule2) Elements enclosed in parentheses are treated as a single element. Thus, "(elem (foo | bar) elem)" allows the token sequences "elem foo elem" and "elem bar elem". *rule The character "*" preceding an element indicates repetition. The full form is "<n>*<m>element" indicating at least <n> and at most <m> occurrences of element. Default values are 0 and infinity so that "*(element)" allows any number, including zero; "1*element" requires at least one; and "1*2element" allows one or two. [rule] Square brackets enclose optional elements; "[foo bar]" is equivalent to "*1(foo bar)". N rule Specific repetition: "<n>(element)" is equivalent to "<n>*<n>(element)"; that is, exactly <n> occurrences of (element). Thus 2DIGIT is a 2-digit number, and 3ALPHA is a string of three alphabetic characters. #rule A construct "#" is defined, similar to "*", for defining lists of elements. The full form is "<n>#<m>element" indicating at least <n> and at most <m> elements, each separated by one or more commas (",") and OPTIONAL linear white space (LWS). This makes the usual form of lists very easy; a rule such as ( *LWS element *( *LWS "," *LWS element )) can be shown as 1#element Wherever this construct is used, null elements are allowed, but do not contribute to the count of elements present. That is, "(element), , (element) " is permitted, but counts as only two elements. Therefore, where at least one element is required, at least one non-null element MUST be present. Default values are 0 and infinity so that "#element" allows any number, including zero; "1#element" requires at least one; and "1#2element" allows one or two. ; comment A semi-colon, set off some distance to the right of rule text, starts a comment that continues to the end of line. This is a simple way of including useful notes in parallel with the specifications. implied *LWS The grammar described by this specification is word-based. Except where noted otherwise, linear white space (LWS) can be included between any two adjacent words (token or quoted-string), and between adjacent words and separators, without changing the interpretation of a field. At least one delimiter (LWS and/or separators) MUST exist between any two tokens (for the definition of "token" below), since they would otherwise be interpreted as a single token.
trans-unit.target: 本文档中指定的所有机制均以散文和增强的Backus-Naur形式（BNF）进行了描述，类似于RFC 822所使用的形式[ 9]。实现者将需要熟悉该符号才能理解此规范。增强的BNF包括以下构造：name = definition规则的名称只是名称本身（不包含任何“ <”和“>”），并由等式“ =”分隔。空白仅在连续行的缩进用于表示跨越多行的规则定义中才有意义。某些基本规则使用大写形式，例如SP，LWS，HT，CRLF，DIGIT，ALPHA等。只要定义中出现尖括号，将有助于辨别规则名称的使用。 “文字”引号括在文字文本周围。除非另有说明，文本不区分大小写。 Rule1 | rule2用竖线（“ |”）分隔的元素是替代方案，例如，“ yes | no”将接受yes或no。 （规则1规则2）括号内的元素被视为单个元素。因此，“（（elem（foo | bar）elem））”允许标记序列“ elem foo elem”和“ elem bar elem”。 *规则元素前面的字符“ *”表示重复。完整形式为“ <n> * <m> element”，表示元素中至少出现<n>个，最多出现<m>个。默认值为0和无穷大，因此“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零； “ 1 * element”至少需要一个； “ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。 [[[Rule1 | rule2用竖线（“ |”）分隔的元素是替代方案，例如，“ yes | no”将接受yes或no。 （规则1规则2）括号内的元素被视为单个元素。因此，“（（elem（foo | bar）elem））”允许标记序列“ elem foo elem”和“ elem bar elem”。 *规则元素前面的字符“ *”表示重复。完整形式为“ <n> * <m> element”，表示元素中至少出现<n>个，最多出现<m>个元素。默认值为0和无穷大，因此“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零； “ 1 * element”至少需要一个； “ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。 [Rule1 | rule2用竖线（“ |”）分隔的元素是替代方案，例如，“ yes | *“表示重复。完整形式为” <n> * <m> element“，表示至少出现<n>个元素，最多出现<m>个元素。默认值为0和[*（element）]允许任何数字，包括零；“ 1 * element”至少需要一个；而“ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。是的“否”将接受是或否。（rule1 rule2）括号中的元素被视为单个元素。因此，“（elem（foo | 2element”允许一个或两个。（elem（foo | bar）elem）”允许标记序列“ elem foo elem”和“ elem bar elem”。* rule元素前面的字符“ *”表示重复。完整形式为“ <n> * <m默认值是0和无穷大，以便“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零；“ 1 * element”至少需要一个；“> element”表示至少<n>个和最多<m>个元素的出现。和“ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。（elem（foo | bar）elem）”允许标记序列“ elem foo elem”和“ elem bar elem”。* rule元素前面的字符“ *”表示重复。完整形式为“ <n> * <m默认值是0和无穷大，以便“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零；“ 1 * element”至少需要一个；“> element”表示至少<n>个和最多<m>个元素的出现。和“ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。最多出现<m>个元素。默认值为0和无穷大，因此“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零； “ 1 * element”至少需要一个； “ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。 [最多出现<m>个元素。默认值为0和无穷大，因此“ *（element）”允许任何数字，包括零； “ 1 * element”至少需要一个； “ 1 * 2element”允许一个或两个。 [规则方括号包含可选元素； “ [foo bar]”等效于“ * 1（foo bar）”。 N条规则的具体重复：“ <n>（元素）”等同于“ <n> * <n>（元素）”；也就是说，恰好<n>次出现（元素）。因此2DIGIT是2位数字，而3ALPHA是3个字母字符的字符串。 #rule与“ *”相似，定义了一个结构“＃”，用于定义元素列表。完整形式为“ <n>＃<m> element”，表示至少<n>个元素和最多<m>个元素，每个元素由一个或多个逗号（“，”）和可选的线性空白（LWS）分隔。这使得列表的通常形式非常容易。规则，例如（* LWS元素*（* LWS，“ * LWS element））可以显示为1＃element在使用此构造的任何地方，都允许使用null元素，但不会对存在的元素进行计数。也就是说，允许”（element），，（element）“ ，但仅计为两个元素。因此，在至少需要一个元素的情况下，必须至少存在一个非空元素。默认值为0和无穷大，因此“ #element”允许任何数字，包括零；“ 1 #element”至少需要一个；而“ 1＃2element”最多需要一个或两个；注释分号（在规则文本右边偏移一段距离）会开始注释，该注释将继续到行尾。一种简单的方法，可以在包含规范的同时包含有用的注释。暗含* LWS本规范描述的语法是基于单词的。除非另有说明，否则可以在任意两个相邻单词（标记或带引号的字符串）之间以及相邻单词和分隔符之间包含线性空白（LWS），而无需更改字段的解释。在任何两个标记之间必须存在至少一个定界符（LWS和/或分隔符）（以下定义为“标记”），因为否则它们将被解释为单个标记。在任何两个标记之间必须存在至少一个定界符（LWS和/或分隔符）（以下定义为“标记”），因为否则它们将被解释为单个标记。在任何两个标记之间必须存在至少一个定界符（LWS和/或分隔符）（以下定义为“标记”），因为否则它们将被解释为单个标记。

trans-unit.source: All present and future subdomains will be HTTPS for a max-age of 1 year. This blocks access to pages or sub domains that can only be served over HTTP.
trans-unit.target: 所有现在和未来的子域都将是HTTPS,最长期限为1年。这将阻止访问只能通过HTTP服务的页面或子域。

trans-unit.source: All responses with one of these status codes send a Location header.
trans-unit.target: 具有这些状态代码之一的所有响应都发送一个 Location 标头。

trans-unit.source: All you need to do is combine multiple Access-Control-Allow-Origin headers into a single one, with commas separating the origins gathered from each copy of the header.
trans-unit.target: 您需要做的就是将多个 Access-Control-Allow-Origin 标头组合成一个标头，并用逗号分隔从标头的每个副本收集的来源。

trans-unit.source: Allow
trans-unit.target: Allow

trans-unit.source: Allow (RFC 2616)
trans-unit.target: 允许(RFC 2616)

trans-unit.source: Allow (RFC 7231)
trans-unit.target: 允许(RFC 7231)

trans-unit.source: Allow credentials:
trans-unit.target: 允许凭证。

trans-unit.source: Allow iframes to use the fullscreen API.
trans-unit.target: 允许iframes使用全屏API。

trans-unit.source: Allowed in HTML forms
trans-unit.target: 允许使用HTML格式

trans-unit.source: Allowed in HTML forms
trans-unit.target: 允许在HTML表格中使用

trans-unit.source: Allowing Flash content
trans-unit.target: 允许使用Flash内容

trans-unit.source: Allowing Java applets
trans-unit.target: 允许Java小程序

trans-unit.source: Allows a sandboxed document to open new windows without forcing the sandboxing flags upon them. This will allow, for example, a third-party advertisement to be safely sandboxed without forcing the same restrictions upon a landing page.
trans-unit.target: 允许沙盒文件打开新的窗口,而不强行在其上设置沙盒标志。例如,这将允许安全地对第三方广告进行沙盒处理,而不对登陆页面施加同样的限制。

trans-unit.source: Allows embedders to have control over whether an iframe can start a presentation session.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入者控制iframe是否可以开始一个演示会话。

trans-unit.source: Allows popups (like from window.open, target="_blank", showModalDialog). If this keyword is not used, that functionality will silently fail.
trans-unit.target: 允许弹出窗口（如 window.open ， target="_blank" ， showModalDialog ）。如果不使用此关键字，则该功能将静默失败。

trans-unit.source: Allows servers to assert that a cookie ought not to be sent along with cross-site requests, which provides some protection against cross-site request forgery attacks (CSRF).
trans-unit.target: 允许服务器断言不应将cookie与跨站点请求一起发送，从而为跨站点请求伪造攻击（CSRF）提供了一些保护。

trans-unit.source: Allows sites to opt in to reporting and/or enforcement of Certificate Transparency requirements, which prevents the use of misissued certificates for that site from going unnoticed. When a site enables the Expect-CT header, they are requesting that Chrome check that any certificate for that site appears in public CT logs.
trans-unit.target: 允许网站选择报告和/或执行证书透明度要求,以防止该网站使用错误签发的证书而不被发现。当网站启用Expect-CT头时,他们要求Chrome检查该网站的任何证书是否出现在公共CT日志中。

trans-unit.source: Allows sites to opt in to reporting and/or enforcement of Certificate Transparency requirements.
trans-unit.target: 允许网站选择报告和/或执行证书透明度要求。

trans-unit.source: Allows the content to be treated as being from its normal origin. If this keyword is not used, the embedded content is treated as being from a unique origin.
trans-unit.target: 允许将内容视为来自其正常来源。如果不使用此关键字,则嵌入的内容将被视为来自唯一的来源。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to disable the ability to lock the screen orientation.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文禁用锁定屏幕方向的功能。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to navigate (load) content to the top-level browsing context. If this keyword is not used, this operation is not allowed.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文将内容导航(加载)到顶层浏览上下文。如果不使用此关键字,则不允许进行此操作。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to open modal windows.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文打开模态窗口。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to run scripts (but not create pop-up windows). If this keyword is not used, this operation is not allowed.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文运行脚本(但不允许创建弹出窗口)。如果不使用此关键字,则不允许进行此操作。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to submit forms. If this keyword is not used, this operation is not allowed.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文提交表单。如果不使用此关键字,则不允许进行此操作。

trans-unit.source: Allows the embedded browsing context to use the Pointer Lock API.
trans-unit.target: 允许嵌入式浏览上下文使用Pointer Lock API。

trans-unit.source: Allows the sender to include additional fields at the end of chunked message.
trans-unit.target: 允许发送者在分块邮件的结尾加入额外的字段。

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of eval() and similar methods for creating code from strings. You must include the single quotes.
trans-unit.target: 允许使用 eval() 和类似方法从字符串创建代码。您必须包括单引号。

trans-unit.source: Allows the use of inline resources, such as inline <script> elements, javascript: URLs, inline event handlers, and inline <style> elements. You must include the single quotes.
trans-unit.target: 允许使用内联资源，例如内联 <script> 元素， javascript: URL，内联事件处理程序和内联 <style> 元素。您必须包括单引号。

trans-unit.source: Allows web developers to experiment with policies by monitoring (but not enforcing) their effects. These violation reports consist of JSON documents sent via an HTTP POST request to the specified URI.
trans-unit.target: 允许Web开发人员通过监视（但不强制执行）效果来试验策略。这些违规报告包含通过HTTP POST 请求发送到指定URI 的JSON文档。

trans-unit.source: Also, by default, prefetching of embedded link hostnames is not performed on documents loaded over HTTPS. On Firefox, this can be changed by setting the network.dns.disablePrefetchFromHTTPS preference to false.
trans-unit.target: 另外，默认情况下，不对通过HTTPS加载的文档执行嵌入式链接主机名的预取。在Firefox上，可以通过将 network.dns.disablePrefetchFromHTTPS 首选项设置为 false 来更改此设置。

trans-unit.source: Also, pay attention not to use a simple regular expression on the BrowserName, user agents also contain strings outside the Keyword/Value syntax. Safari & Chrome contain the string 'like Gecko', for instance.
trans-unit.target: 另外，请注意不要在BrowserName上使用简单的正则表达式，用户代理还包含Keyword / Value语法之外的字符串。例如，Safari和Chrome包含字符串“ like Gecko”。

trans-unit.source: Alt-Svc
trans-unit.target: Alt-Svc

trans-unit.source: Alternative way of specifying redirections
trans-unit.target: 指定重定向的其他方式

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a noreferrerlink relation on an a, area, or link element can be set:
trans-unit.target: 或者，可以设置a，区域或链接元素上的 noreferrer 链接关系：

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, the <meta> element can be used to configure a policy, for example: <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; img-src https://*; child-src 'none';">
trans-unit.target: 或者， <meta> 元素可用于配置策略，例如： <meta http-equiv="Content-Security-Policy" content="default-src 'self'; img-src https://*; child-src 'none';">

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can create hashes from your inline scripts. CSP supports sha256, sha384 and sha512.
trans-unit.target: 另外,你也可以从你的内联脚本中创建哈希。CSP支持sha256、sha384和sha512。

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, you can create hashes from your inline styles. CSP supports sha256, sha384 and sha512.
trans-unit.target: 另外,你也可以从你的内联样式中创建哈希。CSP支持sha256、sha384和sha512。

trans-unit.source: Although Firefox supports data URLs of essentially unlimited length, browsers are not required to support any particular maximum length of data. For example, the Opera 11 browser limited URLs to 65535 characters long which limits data URLs to 65529 characters (65529 characters being the length of the encoded data, not the source, if you use the plain data:, without specifying a MIME type).
trans-unit.target: 尽管Firefox支持的 data URL的长度基本上不受限制，但是浏览器不需要支持任何特定的最大数据长度。例如，Opera 11浏览器将URL限制为65535个字符长，这将 data URL 限制为65529个字符（65529个字符是编码数据的长度，而不是源（如果您使用纯 data: ，则不指定MIME类型））。

trans-unit.source: Although fragment identifiers used within URI references are not sent in requests, implementers ought to be aware that they will be visible to the user agent and any extensions or scripts running as a result of the response. In particular, when a redirect occurs and the original request's fragment identifier is inherited by the new reference in Location (Section 7.1.2), this might have the effect of disclosing one site's fragment to another site. If the first site uses personal information in fragments, it ought to ensure that redirects to other sites include a (possibly empty) fragment component in order to block that inheritance.
trans-unit.target: 尽管URI引用中使用的片段标识符未在请求中发送，但实现者应注意，它们对于用户代理以及作为响应结果而运行的任何扩展或脚本都是可见的。特别是，当发生重定向并且原始请求的片段标识符被Location中的新引用继承（第7.1.2节）时，这可能具有将一个站点的片段公开给另一个站点的作用。如果第一个站点在片段中使用个人信息，则应确保重定向到其他站点包括（可能为空）片段组件，以阻止该继承。

trans-unit.source: Although it is strongly discouraged by Mozilla, some handset manufacturers unfortunately include a token in their device's UA string that represents their device id. If this is the case, the Firefox OS UA string will look like the device-specific string in the table above, where nnnn; is the manufacturer's code for the device (see Guidelines). Some of them we have noticed are of the form "NexusOne;", "ZTEOpen;", or "Open C;" (note that putting space is also discouraged). We provide this information to assist with your UA detection logic, but Mozilla discourages the detection of a device id in UA strings.
trans-unit.target: 尽管Mozilla 强烈建议不要使用它，但不幸的是，某些手机制造商在其设备的UA字符串中包含一个表示其设备ID的令牌。在这种情况下，Firefox OS UA字符串将类似于上表中设备特定的字符串，其中nnnn;是设备的制造商代码（请参阅准则）。我们注意到其中一些格式为“ NexusOne; ”，“ ZTEOpen ”或“ Open C; ”（请注意不要放置空间）。我们提供此信息以帮助您进行UA检测逻辑，但是Mozilla不鼓励检测UA字符串中的设备ID。

trans-unit.source: Although line 11 contains the Cookie destined for the content on http://bar.other, if bar.other did not respond with an Access-Control-Allow-Credentials: true (line 19) the response would be ignored and not made available to web content.
trans-unit.target: 尽管第11行包含发往 http://bar.other //bar.other 的内容的Cookie ，但如果bar.other没有以 Access-Control-Allow-Credentials : true 响应（第19行），则将忽略该响应并将其不可用网站内容。

trans-unit.source: Although the HTTP standard specifies "unauthorized", semantically this response means "unauthenticated". That is, the client must authenticate itself to get the requested response.
trans-unit.target: 虽然HTTP标准规定了 "未授权",但从语义上讲,这个响应意味着 "未认证"。也就是说,客户端必须对自己进行认证才能得到请求的响应。

trans-unit.source:
Although the write locks provide some help in preventing lost updates, they cannot guarantee that updates will never be lost. Consider the following scenario:
Two clients A and B are interested in editing the resource 'index.html'. Client A is an HTTP client rather than a WebDAV client, and so does not know how to perform locking.
Client A doesn't lock the document, but does a GET, and begins editing.
Client B does LOCK, performs a GET and begins editing.
Client B finishes editing, performs a PUT, then an UNLOCK.
Client A performs a PUT, overwriting and losing all of B's changes.
There are several reasons why the WebDAV protocol itself cannot prevent this situation. First, it cannot force all clients to use locking because it must be compatible with HTTP clients that do not comprehend locking. Second, it cannot require servers to support locking because of the variety of repository implementations, some of which rely on reservations and merging rather than on locking. Finally, being stateless, it cannot enforce a sequence of operations like LOCK / GET / PUT / UNLOCK.
WebDAV servers that support locking can reduce the likelihood that clients will accidentally overwrite each other's changes by requiring clients to lock resources before modifying them. Such servers would effectively prevent HTTP 1.0 and HTTP 1.1 clients from modifying resources.
WebDAV clients can be good citizens by using a lock / retrieve / write /unlock sequence of operations (at least by default) whenever they interact with a WebDAV server that supports locking.
HTTP 1.1 clients can be good citizens, avoiding overwriting other clients' changes, by using entity tags in If-Match headers with any requests that would modify resources.
Information managers may attempt to prevent overwrites by implementing client-side procedures requiring locking before modifying WebDAV resources.
trans-unit.target: 虽然写锁在防止丢失更新方面提供了一些帮助,但不能保证更新永远不会丢失。考虑以下场景。两个客户端A和B对编辑资源 "index.html "感兴趣。客户端A是一个HTTP客户端而不是WebDAV客户端,因此不知道如何执行锁定。客户端A没有锁定文档,但进行了GET,并开始编辑。客户端B进行LOCK,执行GET,并开始编辑。客户端B完成编辑,执行PUT,然后进行解锁。客户端A执行了一个PUT,覆盖并丢失了B的所有更改。WebDAV协议本身不能防止这种情况的原因有几个。首先,它不能强制所有的客户端使用锁定,因为它必须与不理解锁定的HTTP客户端兼容。其次,它不能要求服务器支持锁定,因为存储库的实现多种多样,其中一些依赖于保留和合并而不是锁定。最后,由于是无状态的,它不能强制执行LOCK/GET/PUT/UNLOCK这样的操作顺序。支持锁定的WebDAV服务器可以通过要求客户端在修改资源之前锁定资源来降低客户端意外覆盖对方修改的可能性。这样的服务器可以有效防止HTTP 1.0和HTTP 1.1客户端修改资源。每当WebDAV客户端与支持锁定的WebDAV服务器交互时,都可以通过使用锁定/检索/写入/解锁的操作顺序(至少默认情况下是这样)来做一个好公民。HTTP 1.1客户端可以做个好公民,通过在If-Match头中使用实体标签来处理任何会修改资源的请求,避免覆盖其他客户端的更改。信息管理人员可以尝试通过实施客户端程序,要求在修改WebDAV资源之前进行锁定,以防止覆盖。

trans-unit.source: Although this document specifies the requirements for the generation of HTTP/1.1 messages, not all applications will be correct in their implementation. We therefore recommend that operational applications be tolerant of deviations whenever those deviations can be interpreted unambiguously. Clients SHOULD be tolerant in parsing the Status-Line and servers tolerant when parsing the Request-Line. In particular, they SHOULD accept any amount of SP or HT characters between fields, even though only a single SP is required. The line terminator for message-header fields is the sequence CRLF. However, we recommend that applications, when parsing such headers, recognize a single LF as a line terminator and ignore the leading CR. The character set of an entity-body SHOULD be labeled as the lowest common denominator of the character codes used within that body, with the exception that not labeling the entity is preferred over labeling the entity with the labels US-ASCII or ISO-8859-1. See section 3.7.1 and 3.4.1. Additional rules for requirements on parsing and encoding of dates and other potential problems with date encodings include: - HTTP/1.1 clients and caches SHOULD assume that an RFC-850 date which appears to be more than 50 years in the future is in fact in the past (this helps solve the "year 2000" problem). - An HTTP/1.1 implementation MAY internally represent a parsed Expires date as earlier than the proper value, but MUST NOT internally represent a parsed Expires date as later than the proper value. - All expiration-related calculations MUST be done in GMT. The local time zone MUST NOT influence the calculation or comparison of an age or expiration time. - If an HTTP header incorrectly carries a date value with a time zone other than GMT, it MUST be converted into GMT using the most conservative possible conversion.
trans-unit.target: 尽管此文档指定了生成HTTP / 1.1消息的要求，但并非所有应用程序的实现都是正确的。因此，我们建议，只要可以明确地解释那些偏差，操作应用程序就应该容忍这些偏差。客户端在解析状态行时应该容忍，而服务器在解析请求行时应该容忍。特别是，即使只需要一个SP，它们也应该在字段之间接受任意数量的SP或HT字符。邮件标题字段的行终止符是序列CRLF。但是，我们建议应用程序在解析此类标头时，将单个LF识别为行终止符，并忽略前导CR。应将实体实体的字符集标记为该实体中使用的字符代码的最低公分母，除了不标记实体比使用标签US-ASCII或ISO-8859-标记实体更可取。 1。看到第3.7.1 和3.4.1 节。关于日期的解析和编码以及日期编码存在其他潜在问题的其他规则包括：-HTTP / 1.1客户端和缓存应假定RFC-850实际上，未来似乎超过50年的日期实际上是过去的日期（这有助于解决“ 2000年”问题）。 -HTTP / 1.1实现可以内部表示已解析的Expires日期早于适当值，但绝不能内部表示已解析的Expires日期晚于适当值。 -所有与到期相关的计算都必须在格林尼治标准时间进行。当地时区不得影响年龄或失效时间的计算或比较。 -如果HTTP标头错误地带有除GMT以外的时区的日期值，则必须使用最保守的转换将其转换为GMT。

trans-unit.source: Although this status code is intended to describe a response with no body, servers may erroneously include data following the headers. The protocol allows user agents to vary in how they process such responses (discussion regarding this specification text can be found here). This is observable in persistent connections, where the invalid body may include a distinct response to a subsequent request.
trans-unit.target: 尽管此状态码旨在描述没有主体的响应，但是服务器可能错误地在标头之后包含数据。该协议允许用户代理改变其处理此类响应的方式（有关此规范文本的讨论可以在此处找到）。这在持久连接中可以观察到，其中无效主体可能包括对后续请求的独特响应。

trans-unit.source: An HTTP method, a verb (like GET, PUT or POST) or a noun (like HEAD or OPTIONS), that describes the action to be performed. For example, GET indicates that a resource should be fetched or POST means that data is pushed to the server (creating or modifying a resource, or generating a temporary document to send back).
trans-unit.target: 一个HTTP方法，动词（如 GET ， PUT 或 POST ）或名词（例如 HEAD 或 OPTIONS 要被执行），描述动作。例如， GET 表示应提取资源，或 POST 表示将数据推送到服务器（创建或修改资源，或生成临时文档以发送回去）。

trans-unit.source: An Atom Publishing Protocol Category Document, when serialized as XML 1.0, can be identified with the following media type: MIME media type name: application MIME subtype name: atomcat+xml Required parameters: None. Optional parameters: "charset": This parameter has identical semantics to the charset parameter of the "application/xml" media type as specified in [RFC3023]. Encoding considerations: Identical to those of "application/xml" as described in [RFC3023], Section 3.2. Security considerations: As defined in RFC 5023. In addition, as this media type uses the "+xml" convention, it shares the same security considerations as described in [RFC3023], Section 10. Interoperability considerations: There are no known interoperability issues. Published specification: RFC 5023. Applications that use this media type: No known applications currently use this media type. Additional information: Magic number(s): As specified for "application/xml" in [RFC3023], Section 3.2. File extension: .atomcat Fragment identifiers: As specified for "application/xml" in [RFC3023], Section 5. Base URI: As specified in [RFC3023], Section 6. Macintosh file type code: TEXT Person & email address to contact for further information: Joe Gregorio <joe@bitworking.org> Intended usage: COMMON Author/Change controller: IETF (iesg@ietf.org) Internet Engineering Task Force

trans-unit.source: An HTTP method, usually a verb like GET, POST or a noun like OPTIONS or HEAD that defines the operation the client wants to perform. Typically, a client wants to fetch a resource (using GET) or post the value of an HTML form (using POST), though more operations may be needed in other cases.
trans-unit.target: HTTP 方法，通常是动词（如 GET ， POST )或名词（如 OPTIONS 或 HEAD )，用于定义客户端要执行的操作。通常，客户端希望获取资源（使用 GET ）或发布HTML表单的值（使用 POST ），尽管在其他情况下可能需要更多操作。

trans-unit.source: An HTTP Status Code to Report Legal Obstacles
trans-unit.target: 报告法律障碍的HTTP状态码

trans-unit.source: An HTTP message can be either a request from client to server or a response from server to client. Syntactically, the two types of message differ only in the start-line, which is either a request-line (for requests) or a status-line (for responses), and in the algorithm for determining the length of the message body (Section 3.3). In theory, a client could receive requests and a server could receive responses, distinguishing them by their different start-line formats, but, in practice, servers are implemented to only expect a request (a response is interpreted as an unknown or invalid request method) and clients are implemented to only expect a response. start-line = request-line / status-line
trans-unit.target: HTTP消息可以是客户端到服务器的请求，也可以是服务器到客户端的响应。从语法上讲，这两种类型的消息仅在起始行（即请求行（用于请求）或状态行（用于响应））以及用于确定消息正文长度的算法（本节3.3）。从理论上讲，客户端可以接收请求，而服务器可以接收响应，并通过不同的起始行格式来区分它们，但是实际上，服务器被实现为仅期望请求（响应被解释为未知或无效的请求方法），并且客户只希望得到响应。起始行=请求行/状态行

trans-unit.source: An HTTP-date timestamp.
trans-unit.target: 一个HTTP日期的时间戳。

trans-unit.source: An HTTP/1.1 (or later) client sending a message-body SHOULD monitor the network connection for an error status while it is transmitting the request. If the client sees an error status, it SHOULD immediately cease transmitting the body. If the body is being sent using a "chunked" encoding (section 3.6), a zero length chunk and empty trailer MAY be used to prematurely mark the end of the message. If the body was preceded by a Content-Length header, the client MUST close the connection.
trans-unit.target: 发送消息正文的HTTP / 1.1（或更高版本）客户端应该在传输请求时监视网络连接的错误状态。如果客户端看到错误状态，它应该立即停止发送主体。如果使用“块式”编码发送正文（第3.6节），则可以使用零长度的块和空的预告片来过早地标记消息的结尾。如果主体的前面是Content-Length标头，则客户端务必关闭连接。

trans-unit.source: An HTTP/1.1 GET or a POST is used as request method. In the case of a POST, the Content-Type of the request body is one of application/x-www-form-urlencoded, multipart/form-data, or text/plain.
trans-unit.target: HTTP / 1.1 GET 或 POST 用作请求方法。在POST的情况下，请求正文的 Content-Type 是 application/x-www-form-urlencoded ， multipart/form-data 或 text/plain.

trans-unit.source: An HTTP/1.1 server MAY assume that a HTTP/1.1 client intends to maintain a persistent connection unless a Connection header including the connection-token "close" was sent in the request. If the server chooses to close the connection immediately after sending the response, it SHOULD send a Connection header including the connection-token close. An HTTP/1.1 client MAY expect a connection to remain open, but would decide to keep it open based on whether the response from a server contains a Connection header with the connection-token close. In case the client does not want to maintain a connection for more than that request, it SHOULD send a Connection header including the connection-token close. If either the client or the server sends the close token in the Connection header, that request becomes the last one for the connection. Clients and servers SHOULD NOT assume that a persistent connection is maintained for HTTP versions less than 1.1 unless it is explicitly signaled. See section 19.6.2 for more information on backward compatibility with HTTP/1.0 clients. In order to remain persistent, all messages on the connection MUST have a self-defined message length (i.e., one not defined by closure of the connection), as described in section 4.4.
trans-unit.target: HTTP / 1.1服务器可以假定HTTP / 1.1客户端打算维持持久连接，除非在请求中发送了包含连接令牌“ close”的Connection标头。如果服务器选择在发送响应后立即关闭连接，则应该发送一个包含连接令牌关闭的连接头。 HTTP / 1.1客户端可能希望连接保持打开状态，但会根据服务器的响应是否包含带有连接令牌关闭的Connection标头来决定使其保持打开状态。如果客户端不希望为该请求保留更多的连接，则应发送包含连接令牌关闭的Connection标头。如果客户端或服务器在Connection标头中发送关闭令牌，该请求成为连接的最后一个请求。客户端和服务器不应该假定HTTP版本小于1.1的情况下保持持久连接，除非明确发出信号。看到有关与HTTP / 1.0客户端向后兼容的更多信息，请参见第19.6.2节。为了保持持久性，连接上的所有消息都必须具有自定义的消息长度（即，未由连接的关闭定义的消息长度），如第4.4节所述。

trans-unit.source: An IANA registry maintains a complete list of official content encodings.
trans-unit.target: IANA注册管理机构维护官方内容编码的完整列表。

trans-unit.target: 前一个网页的绝对或部分地址,从该网页链接到当前请求的网页。不包括URL碎片(即 "#section")和用户信息(即"_COPY16@example.com/foo/bar/"中的 "用户名:密码")。

trans-unit.source: An entity tag uniquely representing the requested resource. It is a string of ASCII characters placed between double quotes (Like "675af34563dc-tr34") and may be prefixed by W/ to indicate that the weak comparison algorithm should be used.

trans-unit.source: An example of a cross-origin request: The frontend JavaScript code for a web application served from http://domain-a.com uses XMLHttpRequest to make a request for http://api.domain-b.com/data.json.

trans-unit.source: An optional body containing data associated with the request (like content of an HTML form), or the document associated with a response. The presence of the body and its size is specified by the start-line and HTTP headers.

trans-unit.target: 一组可选的HTTP标头，用于指定请求或描述消息中包含的正文。

trans-unit.source: An origin server SHOULD send Last-Modified for any selected representation for which a last modification date can be reasonably and consistently determined, since its use in conditional requests and evaluating cache freshness ([RFC7234]) results in a substantial reduction of HTTP traffic on the Internet and can be a significant factor in improving service scalability and reliability. A representation is typically the sum of many parts behind the resource interface. The last-modified time would usually be the most recent time that any of those parts were changed. How that value is determined for any given resource is an implementation detail beyond the scope of this specification. What matters to HTTP is how recipients of the Last-Modified header field can use its value to make conditional requests and test the validity of locally cached responses. An origin server SHOULD obtain the Last-Modified value of the representation as close as possible to the time that it generates the Date field value for its response. This allows a recipient to make an accurate assessment of the representation's modification time, especially if the representation changes near the time that the response is generated. An origin server with a clock MUST NOT send a Last-Modified date that is later than the server's time of message origination (Date). If the last modification time is derived from implementation-specific metadata that evaluates to some time in the future, according to the origin server's clock, then the origin server MUST replace that value with the message origination date. This prevents a future modification date from having an adverse impact on cache validation. An origin server without a clock MUST NOT assign Last-Modified values to a response unless these values were associated with the resource by some other system or user with a reliable clock.
trans-unit.target: 源服务器应该为可以合理且一致地确定其最后修改日期的任何选定表示形式发送Last-Modified，因为它用于条件请求和评估缓存的新鲜度（[ RFC7234]）导致Internet上HTTP流量的大幅减少，并且可能是提高服务可伸缩性和可靠性的重要因素。表示形式通常是资源接口后面许多部分的总和。最后修改时间通常是这些部分中任何一个被更改的最新时间。如何为任何给定资源确定该值是超出本规范范围的实现细节。对HTTP而言重要的是Last-Modified头字段的接收者如何使用其值来发出条件请求并测试本地缓存的响应的有效性。原始服务器应该获取表示的Last-Modified值，该表示值应尽可能接近为其响应生成Date字段值的时间。这使接收者可以准确评估表示的修改时间，特别是如果表示在生成响应的时间附近发生更改时。带有时钟的原始服务器不得发送上次修改的日期，该日期晚于该服务器的消息产生时间（日期）。如果最后修改时间是从特定实现的元数据中得出的，该元数据会根据源服务器的时钟在将来某个时间进行评估，则源服务器必须将该值替换为消息起始日期。这样可以防止将来的修改日期对缓存验证产生不利影响。没有时钟的原始服务器绝不能为响应分配Last-Modified值，除非其他系统或用户使用可靠的时钟将这些值与资源相关联。
